title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when choosing SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText component emits a beep sound when selecting SWT.MULTI option. This behavior appears to be unintended.
OB: When selecting SWT.MULTI option in the ControlExampleText component, the component emits a beep sound.
EB: When selecting the SWT.MULTI option in the ControlExampleText component, the component should not emit a beep sound.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch the application with build F1 (20020521) on Win2K.
2. Open the SWT example ControlExample.
3. Select the Text tab.
4. Click on the 'Styles' button.
5. Choose the 'SWT.SINGLE' option.
6. Click on the 'Styles' button again.
7. Select the 'SWT.MULTI' option.
8. Observe that the ControlExampleText component emits a beep sound when selecting SWT.MULTI.
